Posts.Content: hummer wrote: Hi, I have just been diagnosed with Infiltrating ductal carcinoma.  Tomorrow is the MRI and the next day is the surgeon's appointment.  I am terrified.   My husband and I have spent most of this week-end reading the materials the cancer coordinator gave us.  I am trying to have a good attitude even though the sentinel node biopsy is positive and so I am worried about spread.  I feel like I did all the right things (mammograms, don't smoke, eat healthy, am active) and yet here it is.  I found the large lump (3 cm) Dec. 10th.  My last mammogram in March was fine.  I had an ultrasound guided biopsy on Wed and got the results on Friday.  My son actually found this site and told me to go to it.  What a wonderful thing to be able to share thoughts and experiences. Any words of wisdom or encouragement out there? Posts.Title: Just diagnosed hummer Jen44

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2008 05:44PM hummer wrote: Hi Jenny, Thanks for your kind hopeful comments.  I haven't started laughing yet but believe that time will come.  By the way, my visit with the surgeon was awful.  My husband and daughter-in-law came with me and she didn't  acknowledge them or even ask who they were.  Pretty much she was "cut and dry" pardon the surgeon pun.  No empathy.  I know surgeons are necessarily like that but it would have been nice if she at least said, "I'm sorry" or 'keep a positive attitiude" or lots of advances have been made in treatments.  What she said was basically, "you  have three choices, lumpectomy - since the tumor is large you will be assymetrical, mastectomy with reconstruction or mastectomy without reconstruction.  It's your choice."  I know it's my choice but it's not like ordering from a menu like, "I guess I'll take today's special."  I asked her for something to help me sleep and she said, I can give you a couple pills but they aren't going to help the anxiety, it will still be there.  She didn't offer any other options.  Needless to say, I'm not going back there.  Basically the whole experience was terrible.  Both my daughter-in-law and husband felt the same way.  I did have her fax my records to the oncologist I want to see and I also have the name of another surgeon recommended by my friend who recommended the oncologist.  I've spoken to the oncologist's office and they will review the records and call me in a day or two to schedule.  I'm just glad I have BCBS PPO and can choose to go somewhere else.  So I can say to you "keep laughing and I will try to start!" Hummer
